reviewText: A great documentary on the Latinos and their involvement in the Vietnam War!  Bought it as a gift for my dad and he loves it!

Same thing happened to my graduating class of 1965.  Out of 119 high school graduates, at least 5 served in Vietnam.  What I didn't like is that they portrayed these men as not very intelligent, that they were the bottom of the barrel somehow.  That's not true those who survived are good, smart courageous family men. Still I am grateful their story is being told.

As a veteran of the Vietnam War I found that educating myself about the war has helped me to control my PTSD symptoms. This documentary provides details of the war I was not aware of... I am thankful to the author for his research and publication...
